page.title: 13THE VOLKS RAILWAY
page.content: Volks Railway was built and designed by Magnus Volk and opened on the 4th. August 1883. The line was rebuilt in 1884 since which date a regular service has run along the beach. Originally the line ran from the Chain Pier to Paston Place. There was a seashore railway to Rottingdean from 1896 but it had to be closed in 1900 due to the construction of groynes into the sea. In 1901 the original railway was extended to Black Rock and a new station built. The line was shortened to facilitate the new Black Rock swimming pool and the terminals demolished during the second World War. After the war new stations were built at Black Rock and the Aquarium. Magnus Volk died at the age of 82 in 1937 and the Council took over the line in 1940. Today it runs in the summer season only.
